biography.summary: Tim Scott is a Republican U.S. Senator from South Carolina, serving since 2013. He previously served in the U.S. House (2011-2013) and has focused on economic opportunity, education, and conservative policy priorities.
biography.early_life: Born September 19, 1965, in North Charleston, South Carolina. Raised in a working-class family with strong community ties.
biography.education: Attended Charleston Southern University; studied political science.
biography.career: Former Charleston County Council member; served in the U.S. House (2011-2013) and has been a U.S. Senator since 2013.

contact.office_address: 104 Hart Senate Office Building Washington DC 20510
